test_scenario: User logs in with valid email and password
expected_result:
- User is successfully logged in
- Redirected to dashboard/home page
- User name displayed in header
- JWT token stored in browser
screenshot_instructions:
1. Login form filled with test data
2. Dashboard after successful login showing user name
3. Browser DevTools → Application → Local Storage showing token

test_scenario: Login with correct email but wrong password
expected_result:
- Login fails
- Error message displayed: "Invalid credentials" or similar
- User remains on login page
- No token stored
- HTTP 401 status
screenshot_instructions:
1. Login form with wrong password
2. Error message displayed in red
3. Network tab showing 401 response

expected_result:
- Validation error shown
- Message: "Please enter a valid email address"
- Submit button disabled or validation prevents submission
- No API call made
screenshot_instructions:
1. Form showing invalid email
2. Validation error message under email field
3. Network tab showing no API request

expected_result:
- Validation errors for both fields
- Message: "Email is required"
- Message: "Password is required"
- Form not submitted
screenshot_instructions:
1. Empty login form
2. Required field errors displayed
3. Submit button state

expected_result:
- Login fails
- Error message: "Invalid credentials"
- HTTP 401 status
- No token generated
screenshot_instructions:
1. Login form with non-existent email
2. Error message displayed
3. Network response showing 401

test_scenario: Login with valid credentials via API
screenshot_instructions:
Use Postman/Thunder Client:
1. Request body with test data
2. Response showing 200 status

test_scenario: Login with wrong password via API
expected_result:
- HTTP 401 Unauthorized

    "success": false,
    "error": "Invalid credentials"
  }
- No token returned
screenshot_instructions:
1. Request with wrong password
2. 401 response status
3. Error message in response

test_scenario: Get current user profile with valid token
screenshot_instructions:

expected_result:

test_scenario: Update profile with password less than 8 characters
expected_result:

- Error: "Password must be at least 8 characters"
- Profile not updated

2. 400 response
3. Validation error message

test_scenario: Admin creates new user with valid data
test_data:
Logged in as: Admin

Name: New User
Email: newuser@test.com
Password: Password123!
Role: user
expected_result:
- User created successfully
- Success message displayed
- New user appears in users list
- User can login with credentials
screenshot_instructions:
1. Create user form (Admin logged in)
2. Success notification
3. Users list showing new user
4. Successful login as new user

test_data:
Logged in as: Admin

Email: user@test.com (already exists)
expected_result:
- User creation fails
- Error message: "Email already exists" or "Email must be unique"
- HTTP 409 Conflict
- No duplicate user created
screenshot_instructions:
1. Form with duplicate email
2. Error message displayed
3. Network tab showing 409 response
4. Database check (users list unchanged)

test_scenario: Admin tries to create Superadmin user

- No superadmin user created

1. Role dropdown showing available roles
2. Error message if attempted
3. Permission denied notification

test_scenario: Admin creates user with valid data
test_data:
Headers:
Authorization: Bearer [ADMIN_TOKEN]

Body:
{
  "name": "API Test User",
  "email": "apitest@test.com",
  "password": "SecurePass123!",
  "role": "user"
}
expected_result:
- HTTP 201 Created
- Response contains new user (without password)
- User can login
- User exists in database

2. 201 response
3. Created user object
4. Database query showing new user

test_scenario: User tries to update another user's profile
test_data:
Headers:
Authorization: Bearer [USER1_TOKEN]

Path:
/users/[USER2_ID]

Body:
{
  "name": "Hacked Name"
}
expected_result:
- HTTP 403 Forbidden
- Error: "You can only update your own profile"
- Target user's data unchanged
screenshot_instructions:
1. Request to update different user
2. 403 response
3. Error message
4. Database showing unchanged data

expected_result:
- HTTP 400 Bad Request
- Error: "You cannot delete your own account"
- Admin user remains in database
screenshot_instructions:
1. DELETE request to own user ID
2. 400 response
3. Error message
4. Database check (user still exists)

test_scenario: User creates event with valid data
test_data:
Logged in as: User

Title: Test Event
Description: Test Description
Event Date: 2025-12-31
Event Time: 14:00
Reg Start: 2025-11-01 09:00
Reg End: 2025-12-30 17:00
Location: Main Auditorium
Max Attendees: 100
expected_result:
- Event created successfully
- Status: "draft"
- Success message displayed
- Event appears in "My Events"
- All data saved correctly
screenshot_instructions:
1. Create event form filled
2. Success notification
3. Event in "My Events" with draft status
4. Event detail page

test_scenario: Create event with invalid date format

expected_result:

test_scenario: USER submits draft event for approval
test_data:
Logged in as: User
Event Status: Draft
expected_result:
- Event status changes to "Pending Approval"
- Success message: "Event submitted for approval"
- Submit button no longer visible
- Event appears in approver's pending list
screenshot_instructions:
1. Draft event detail page
2. Submit for approval button
3. Success message
4. Updated status showing "Pending Approval"
5. Event in approver's queue

test_data:
Logged in as: Approver
Event Status: Pending Approval
expected_result:
- Event status changes to "Published"
- Event visible on public events page
- Approval recorded in history
- Creator notified (if applicable)
screenshot_instructions:
1. Pending approvals list
2. Event detail with approve button
3. Success notification
4. Event now showing "Published"
5. Public events page showing event

test_scenario: User registers for published event within registration period
test_data:
Logged in as: User
Event: Published
Current Date: Within registration period
Available Slots: > 0
expected_result:
- Registration successful
- Success message displayed
- Register button changes to "Unregister"
- User appears in attendees list
- Registration count increased
screenshot_instructions:
1. Event detail with Register button
2. Success notification
3. Button now showing "Unregister"

5. Updated registration count

test_scenario: User tries to register for event twice
test_data:
Logged in as: User (already registered)
Event: Same published event
expected_result:
- Registration blocked
- Error: "You are already registered for this event"
- HTTP 409 Conflict
- No duplicate registration
screenshot_instructions:
1. Event showing "Unregister" button
2. Error message if clicked
3. Network showing 409 response
4. Single registration in database

test_scenario: User tries to register after registration period ended
